ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Measurement artifact due to insert earphones
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Low-frequency thresholds were artificially elevated by the use of insert earphones in an ear with a patent PE tube (low impedance), confirmed by improvement with supra-aural headphones.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Otitis Media with patent PE tube
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient has a history of chronic OM and a patent PE tube in the right ear, which is functioning correctly despite the initial misleading audiometric findings.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ossicular chain discontinuity or fixation
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initially suspected due to the apparent worsening of air-bone gaps post-surgery, but ruled out when thresholds improved with supra-aural headphones.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To inspect the ear canal and determine the status of the tympanic membrane and PE tube.
To evaluate middle ear function and confirm the patency of the PE tube via ear canal volume.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc and support middle ear status findings.
Initial assessment of hearing thresholds using standard insert earphones.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Re-evaluation using supra-aural headphones to investigate the discrepancy in low-frequency thresholds.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Pre-operative evaluation 7 months prior to the current visit. Results showed a moderate conductive hearing loss in the right ear, establishing a baseline before PE tube insertion.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear moderate conductive hearing loss at 250-500 Hz (45 dB HL), rising to mild at 1000-6000 Hz. Obtained with insert earphones.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Post-operative check 2 months after PE tube insertion. Results indicated a 'paradoxical worsening' of hearing in the low frequencies despite a functional PE tube, which confused the clinical picture.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear thresholds worsened compared to pre-op: 65 dB HL at 250 Hz and 55 dB HL at 500 Hz (20 dB and 10 dB poorer, respectively). Obtained with insert earphones.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Current follow-up visit. Initial testing with insert earphones replicated the 'worsened' results. However, re-testing with supra-aural headphones revealed significantly better low-frequency thresholds, confirming that the previous 'loss' was an artifact caused by using insert earphones in an ear with a patent PE tube.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Right PE tube patent; Left ear normal.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear flat (Type B) with abnormally large ear canal volume (2.4 mL), consistent with patent PE tube. Left ear normal.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes absent. Left ipsilateral reflexes present.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Using insert earphones: Right ear thresholds comparable to V2 (poor low-frequency thresholds, e.g., 65 dB HL at 250 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs in agreement with PTAs (RE 25 dB HL, LE 10 dB HL). Word recognition excellent (96%) bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Using supra-aural headphones: Significant improvement in right ear low-frequency thresholds (15 dB improvement at 250 and 500 Hz) compared to inserts.

proposed_items: Continue antibiotics for Otitis Media as prescribed by otolaryngologist
Monitor PE tube status and hearing sensitivity
Use supra-aural headphones for future audiometric evaluations of the right ear
counseling_actions: Explain that the reported 'worsening' of hearing was a measurement artifact caused by the type of earphones used, not a medical complication
Clarify that the PE tube is patent and functioning correctly
Reassure the patient that no additional surgical intervention is needed for the apparent hearing loss

escalation.rationale_short: To report the corrected hearing thresholds and confirm that the previous 'worsening' was a testing artifact, preventing unnecessary medical intervention.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor resolution of OM and status of the PE tube using appropriate audiometric transducers.

expected_outcome: Right ear serous OM appears to have resolved through otological intervention.
No drainage present in the right ear canal.
Patient was not unnecessarily treated as if additional middle-ear complications were present.
